item.title: “Golden Dragon” | China and Cambodia begin the largest joint military exercises of their history
item.description: China and Cambodia began yesterday the largest joint military maneuvers ever between the two countries, involving state -of -the -art Chinese military equipment, including artillery, war ships and robotic combat dogs. About 900 Chinese soldiers and more than 1,300 Cambojan soldiers participate in the exercises, which will extend until May 28, according to a statement from the Khmer Royal Forces (RCAF, Cambodia). According to the statement, will be presented state -of -the -art Chinese military equipment, including armored vehicles, helicopters, war ships, recognition drones and robotic combat dogs. The objective is to “develop narrower ties and cooperation” between the two armies. "The exercises are larger than last year in terms of personnel and equipment," RCAF spokesman Thong Solimo told AFP, adding that a Chinese war ship, Chanbai Shan, attracted Ream Cambodian naval base with the equipment. The ream base in southwest of Cambodia was renewed by China and inaugurated on April 2 by Prime Minister Cambodian Hun Manet and a Chinese military delegation. “China wants to show its muscles” and send the message that “it is a superpower”, through these exercises, nicknamed “Golden Dragon,” argued or Virak, a Cambodian political expert, quoted by the French news agency. In addition to this demonstration of strength, China must also “give confidence to its partners, telling them that China is growing, developing and becoming stronger, both in terms of dimension and technological progress and military power,” he added or Virak. Cambodia should also receive two China war ships. The first joint military exercises, called “Golden Dragon”, took place in 2016 and, in early 2017, Cambodia ended the “Angkor Sentinel”, a similar joint exercise that had been organized in the previous seven years with US forces.

item.title: COVID-19 | Macau exceeded peak infections
item.description:
Covid-19 infections have been progressively decreased since half of March, when the peak has been reached, but health services warn that coronavirus is still active in the territory. Authorities add that this year there were no deaths resulting from Covid-19
While in the neighboring regions of Macao, COVID-19 infection cases continue to increase, here infection rates have been gradually descended since half of March, health services indicated in a statement released on Tuesday night. Authorities add that although the Mand has surpassed the most critical point of covid-19 infections, coronavirus remains active in the territory. As such, they appeal to the care and adoption of preventive attitudes, especially between risk groups, such as elderly, chronic diseases and people with weakened immune system, namely taking complete vaccination against the JN.1 variant. Regarding the evolution of infection rates in Macao and neighboring regions, the entity led by Alvis Lo explains that Macau entered the infectious peak before the surrounding areas. According to laboratory monitoring data, the positivity rate of the new coronaviruses detected in patients with flu symptoms in Macau began to increase in late February this year, reaching the peak in mid -March. In March 16 and 22, the authorities record a positivity rate of 44.3 percent, which was decreasing from there. In the last three weeks, the positivity rate has come down to 12 percent, rose to 17 percent and then went back to 11 percent, "which indicates a slight recovery," the health services concluded. Walk there With regard to collective infections that result in flu symptoms, between the beginning of the year and this week 111 cases were recorded, of which 26 were from COVID-19, detected mainly in elderly homes. In these cases, the authorities ensure that they have adequate medical services to the elderly homes, prescribing antiviral medications. Throughout this year, so far, Macao has not registered any critical or fatal case caused by Covid-19 infection, is indicated. The prevalent coronavirus variant in Macao is currently the XDV variant related to DN.1, which is basically the same that circulates in the surrounding areas. The latest data do not show that XDV causes more serious illnesses than JN.1, XBB and its descendant strains. As such, health services ensure that the JN.1 variant vaccine remains effective in reducing “risk of infection and developing serious diseases caused by the currently prevalent variant.

item.title: BNU | 133.2 million profits in the first quarter
item.description:
Positive results show a 30 million patacas reduction compared to last year's first quarter. The reduction of the financial net margin was the main factor to contribute to the reduction of gains
In the first three months of the year, the Nacional Overseas Bank presented a non -audited profit of 133.2 million patacas, according to a statement issued yesterday. The value represents a reduction of 30 million patacas, or 18.4 percent, compared to the first quarter of 2024, when the profit had reached 163.2 million patacas. Despite the reduction of profits, the amount is still above 2023 levels, when the institution declared a profit to the first quarter of 122.4 million patacas. The amounts presented yesterday are also close to what was happening in 2019, the last year before the pandemic, when profits in the first in the first quarter reached 138 million Patacas. The most recent results were explained with a decrease in the net financial margin, which presented a reduction of 31.2 million patacas, or 11.8 percent, compared to the same period. Among the facts that contributed to this amendment, the institution pointed out the “changes in the composition of deposits and the evolution of reference interest rates”. However, there were areas where the bank was able to get better results, as happened with liquid commissions, an area where an increase in gains of 3.8 million patacas was generated, equivalent to 18.1 percent. The increase was explained with "greater economic activity and greater customer involvement." Squeezed In the first quarter of this year, impairment losses related to credit exhibitions, mischievous credit, and financial investments increased to 5.4 million patacas, compared to the value of 1.3 million patacas in the first quarter of 2024. According to BNU, this increase took into account the “prudent provisioning practices”. "Despite this increase, the quality of BNU assets remains solid, supported by conservative credit practices and a robust level of provisions to respond to ongoing macroeconomic uncertainties," he was guaranteed. At the same time, operating expenses increased by 1.1 percent in homologous terms, which according to the institution showed “the effectiveness of bank cost optimization initiatives”. “Efficiency gains resulting from process simplification and strategic review of service supply helped compensate added investments in digital transformation, talent development and brand reinforcement,” was considered. Last year, the institution led by Carlos Cid Álvares ended the year with a profit of 585.1 million patacas.

item.title: IAS | Number of families supported up to the highest value since 2020
item.description:
Although the value of the threshold of poverty in Macau was not up to date for almost five years, the number of families supported by the Inclusion and Harmony Program in the community again exceeded the 5,500 barrier. May registration represented an annual growth of almost 13 percent
The number of monoparental families, with people with disabilities, or with chronic patients who will receive the May Special Grant from the Inclusion and Harmony Program in the community has risen to 5,540. With a growth of 12.9 percent compared to the same period last year, this is the highest value, at least since 2020, according to the Institute of Social Action (IAS). This program is intended to “alleviate life pressure” of single-padded families, people with disabilities or chronic patients considered “vulnerable”. Last year, the number of approved families to receive May support to face poverty had been 4,905, a reduction in the face of 2023, when the number of aided families had been 4,049. Since 2021 that the number of families gathering conditions to access this support has not exceeded 5,000, which totaled 5,043. However, the highest value of the recent years was recorded by 2020 during the pandemic when a total of 5,503 families were supported. The community inclusion and harmony program foresees the distribution of two supports, one in May and one in October, which are accessed through applications approved by IAS. It should be noted that the data presented only consider only the distribution of support in May of previous years. Natural Trends Among the 5,540 subsidized families is a total of 1,300 household aggregates who also receive the allowance for people in economic lack. These families are the poorest in the territory, whose monthly income is below what is considered the threshold of the social risk of poverty. This level represents yields of 4,350 patacas per month, in the case of a single individual, rises to 7,990 patacas per month in households with two people, 11,020 patacas, in families with three people, 13,390 patacas with four people, 15,120 patacas when the aggregate consists of five people, progressively rising up to 20,270 patacas for eight or more members. These numbers have not undergone any change since 2019, in the first month of the Ho IAT SENG term, so they do not take into account the inflation of later years, which makes these amounts of purchasing power less than December 2019. Regarding families with income below the social risk of poverty, the number of supports has been falling every year since 2020. In this year, there were 1,618 aggregates to receive the May subsidy of the community inclusion and harmony program, which was reduced to 1,576 in 2021, then to 1,486 by 2022, 1,385, at 2023, 1,308, until 1,300 families this year. Less is no longer The increase in the number of supported families is explained by the growth of households with monthly income above the social risk of poverty, but lower than the maximum limits for these supports. For aggregates with more than one person, the maximum limit of monthly income to access this support is 7,830 patacas, rises to 13,983 patacas per month in the aggregates with two people, 18,737 patacas in families with three members, 22,094 patacas in four members, 24,192 patacas in families with five members. The value rises progressively until it reaches the limit of 29,392 patacas per month, when families have eight or more members. In 2020, the number of families under these conditions was 3,885, but fell to 3,467 in 2021 and to 3,125 in 2022, the lowest value since 2020. However, since this year the number of families in this income interval increased to 4,240. This is an increase of 335 families compared to the first year of the pandemic. Supports of 22.55 million The community inclusion and harmony program foresees the distribution of a total of 22.55 million patacas in May this year, the highest value since 2020, when 23.67 million patacas were distributed. The program foresees the distribution of supports ranging from 2,650 patacas to household aggregates with a single person, and 10,100 patacas, when the aggregate consists of eight or more members, so an increase in the number of supported families does not necessarily reflect an increase in total distributed supports. This support is distributed intended for single people with children in kindergarten, primary school, secondary or higher education; as well as households with members with chronic diseases or disabilities that are not admitted to public homes or subsidized by the government or in medical establishments dependent on health services.

item.title: Metro | People's Covenant defends acceleration of connection to China
item.description:
The covenant of the people wants the planning of the Light Metro Network to take into account the links to Zhuhai and the National Railway Network. A guardian linked to the Fujian community argues that the light meter should be the main transport in Macao, with buses playing a complementary role
The slight meter should be the main means of public transport in Macao, while buses move to a secondary and complementary role. The position was taken by Tong Ho Laam, vowel of the executive board of the Povo's covenant of Macao, the official name, in statements to the newspaper or Mun. Given the expected increase in demand and pressure on the public transport network and traffic in the city, the official indicated that the government should actively promote the strategy of making the meter light the main means of transportation in the city to relieve road pressure. Tong Ho Laam understands that when the lightweight metro stations network is extended, it will increase the overall effectiveness of public transport and ensure better experiences to residents and tourists. One of the improvements that can be implemented in the short-term is the ability to use electronic payments and harmonize the connection with buses. In addition, the People's Covenant leader argues that the planning of Light Metro stations should be done in articulation with the Regional Industrial Development Strategy. An essential point is to ensure the connection with the national rail network through Zhuhai, a work that should be accelerated to reinforce Macao's position in the Great Bay. The vowel believes that the connection to China, namely Hengqin, can bring a new impetus to the local industrial sector to pursue emerging areas at the Traditional Chinese Technological Innovation and Mountain Medicine poles. Cure for all ills Given the energy challenges resulting from the fight against climate change, the associative leader argues that the development of the light meter should be thought of from a long-term perspective, taking into account environmental protection. To this end, the MSar should reserve land for green energy production facilities to feed the slight meter. Tong Ho Laam pointed out this objective as a way for the Mand to stand out in environmental terms in the Great Bay area, adopting leadership in the goal of carbonic neutrality, while promoting economic diversification.

item.title: Teaching | IA contents transmitted to local students
item.description:
The Macao government says it is preparing students, teaching system and teachers for artificial intelligence, providing didactic materials in schools, classes and organizing training actions. Deputies also want initiatives on artificial intelligence outside schools
Schools and teachers are preparing for the reality of Artificial Intelligence (IA). According to the secretary's explanations for Social Affairs and Culture, the LAM, the Directorate of Services for Youth Education and Development (DSEDJ) “intends to provide AI content or related to science and technology, with an average duration of 10 hours per year, computer teachers and 6 hours to teachers of other subjects”, was referred to yesterday in response to an oral interpellation of Deputy Lam Lon Wai. The first actions already took place in the current school year. In addition, the secretary confirmed that schools can adhere to manuals that include AI teachings. "Several reference materials on the interior of China were introduced for adoption in schools," said Lam. Last year, DSEDJ joined South China Normal University to "establish a new basis for learning and exchange focusing on AI teaching." In this context, “didactic materials of this institution on the AI” are made available, and invitations are foreseen to “interior experts and academics to provide training and support for teaching staff in the development of AI teaching activities”. At the legislative level, the executive says he made the necessary changes to “the program and teaching of AI become part of the curricula of primary and secondary schools”, and it is intended that “AI contents can be integrated into the curriculum guidelines of information technology classes”. The government intends to make the “interleavement evaluation of the planning of non-higher education in Macao, to build an innovative technological support system”, taking into account the “general lines of planning for the construction of a large educational power (2024-2035)”. LAM indicated that, through the financing of the Educational Fund, it is intended to “optimize facilities and school equipment” to improve science teaching and create the “AI” classrooms project. In this context, DSEDJ launched this year the pilot project of “Intelligent Teaching” to which 25 schools joined. "The established goal is to make the platform available to all secondary schools in Macao in the school year 2026/2027," the secretary said yesterday. I was going to everyone One of the interveners in yesterday's debate was Deputy Zheng Anting, who defended the partnership with playing operators for the creation of “AI classes” in hotels, in conjunction with tourists who pass through these spaces or even in community neighborhoods, “so that populations have greater contact with AI”. "We can develop actions in partnership with the six dealers, because they already have visitors," he added. Regarding the AI ​​relationship with the population and the promotion of literacy in this area for adults, a representative of the Macau Science Center said this space can be “an open classroom so that, outside schools, new knowledge and learning scenarios of AI can be provided”. "We will collaborate with more technology companies, because we want to have more technological resources to support this scientific background. The Science Center will create different measures to improve the digital literacy of the population by introducing AI, and so we can generalize education for AI for the whole society. The evolution of AI has been fast and we will invite experts to share the most advanced techniques and employment trends in this area, in order to create an AI training platform. The official said that "shift workers could access this type of resources." LAM has ensured that the future goes through the "generalization of AI education for residents" and, for this, the government will "dialogue with associations so that these measures have a greater effect."

item.title: Lisboeta Macau welcomes photographs of Hiroshi Sugimoto
item.description: It takes place until June 30 the show “Eternal Imaging’: photography exhibition of Hiroshi Sugimoto ”, patent at the HWA's gallery, in the“ Art H853 ”space in the Lisbon Macao venture. According to a note from the organization, the public can see “Limited Publications of the renowned Publisher Kyoto Shoin Co., Ltd, Koyanagi Gallery, Tokyo, and Mori Art Museum, also in Tokyo”, and are presented “great -shaped color photographs of the Opticks series, released for the first time in the Kyoto City Kyocera Museum of Arte's commemorative exhibition”. In the case of the “Seascape” series, created in 1980, the Japanese photographer “records an elementary scene, the sky and the sea”, in a “ancient one that connects today's people to ancient times and that thus reflects eternity”. In turn, in the series of works entitled "Theater", comes "an over-exposed screen that compresses a two-hour movie in a white beam of light, encompassing both our consciousness and our subconscious perceptions." In the case of the "Opticks" series, "the red, blue and green tones, presenting small colored particles under the lens, show the multifaceted nature of light through the prism." The organizers of the exhibition intend to "awaken the collective memories that are dormant in the images, related to the old, ephemeral and eternity." The place of philosophy Born in 1948 in Tokyo, Hiroshi Sugimoto continues to work in this city, but also in New York. Considered a "of photographers with greater philosophical depth in contemporary art," with a work that "explores time, memory, history and the essence of existence through minimalist formats." Sugimoto is also considered “excellent in using photography as a 'time container', condensing abstract concepts in eternal images that evoke the contemplation of life and cosmos through their serene stillness”. Since 2023, he has been a member of the Japanese Academy of Arts, having received the National Arts Club photography medal in New York in 2018. The Japanese photographer also belongs to the Real Academy of Belgium, having an honorary doctorate attributed by the prestigious Parsons School of Design, also located in New York, USA. Has works in selected museum collections such as the Modern Museum of Art (MoMA), in New York, or or Metropolitan Museum, in the same city; As well as Tate in London and Getty Museum in Los Angeles, among others.

item.title: Range and Route | Colombia confirms adherence to the Chinese initiative
item.description:
In the Chinese capital to participate in the China-Celac Forum (Latin American and Caribbean Community), Colombian President Gustavo Petro signed a memorandum to join the Track and Route International Trade Initiative
China and Colombia signed yesterday in Beijing a cooperation plan for the Latin American country to join the Chinese track and route initiative, confirmed the Colombian presidency through the social network X. The Memorandum, signed in Beijing by the leaders of both countries, Xi Jinping and Gustavo Petro, brings together Colombia to an initiative with which the Asian giant intends to generate an international trade network and Extend its influence worldwide through the construction of infrastructure, and to which more than twenty countries in Latin America and Caribbean have joined. “Under this meeting, Colombia has signed an important economic cooperation agreement for the adhesion of our country to the [initiative] track and route,” says the Colombian presidency. Xi and Petro gathered yesterday to reinforce bilateral ties by signing new agreements, including this, among all the most emblematic. Before traveling to China, Petro revealed that on his previous voyage to the Asian country in October 2023, he intended to sign this memorandum, but at the time it was not possible due to an alleged mistake of his previous Foreign Minister, Álvaro Leyva. "This is what I am going to do now, an agreement of intent; future governments will see if the intention comes true, and must come true," the Colombian president said. Petro was with Xi on Tuesday at the opening of the China-Celac Forum (Latin American and Caribbean Community) in the Chinese capital, where he appealed to a dialogue between civilizations “free from authoritarianism and imperialism”. The trade scale between Colombia and China is particularly unfavorable to the Latin American country, whose annual deficit is about $ 14 billion. By 2024, Colombia exported $ 2.38 billion from goods to China and imported $ 15.9 billion from Chinese products. In addition, between 1994 and 2023, China invested $ 813.3 million in Colombia -yet a value far lower than the United States and Spain -concentrated in sectors such as infrastructure, mining exploration, energy and transport. Other ties In addition to trade, Colombia is trying to reinforce technological cooperation with China. On Tuesday, Petro visited the headquarters of the Huawei 'giant' in Beijing telecommunications, where, according to Colombian Minister of Information and Communications Technology, Julián Molina, eventual initiatives for cooperation in the domains of artificial intelligence, data infrastructure and connectivity were discussed. Petro's government's interest in strengthening commercial ties with China during the visit has caused internal controversy, due to the fear of any negative repercussions on the relationship with the United States, Colombia's largest commercial partner.

item.title: Macau maintains shipping by air to the United States
item.description: The Macau Post Office Director told Lusa yesterday that, unlike neighboring Hong Kong, the region kept ordering orders to the United States (USA), but only by air. On May 2, the US government eliminated the exemption of customs rights on small orders from mainland China and Hong Kong, such as those sent by the giants of Electronic Trade Shein and Temu. "In practice, now Macau is not included and the mail [which] goes to the United States is walking, except maritime. The rest, we keep normal," said Derby Lau Wai Meng. The Director of Post and Telecommunications Services (CTT) explained that the shipping of any goods, from sea to the US, implies a passage through Hong Kong, one of the busiest ports in the world. That is, there is only the hypothesis of sending orders by air, confirmed Derby Lau. "This case is sensitive," admitted the leader. "I think it's better not to talk [this subject], because the best thing is not to remember us," he added. item.title: ANA CRISTINA ALVES
item.description: Ana Cristina Alves, auxiliary researcher and coordinator of the Educational Service of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center May 2025 In Chinese proverbial lessons I discovered great affinities between spontaneous Chinese popular philosophy, which runs from mouth to mouth, and the Christian proverbial wisdom, also made so that believers, in every corner of the globe, could memorize, repeat and disseminate. Nothing like the other's knowledge to bring and dispel prejudice, being one of the most usual that Chinese are extremely pragmatic and cold. But when we come across proverbs such as “love others as yourself,” in a direct translation and faithful to the original “爱人如己” (ài Rú Rú Jǐ), such leads us to think twice, it seems not to be here just a matter of respect, uncharged and formal, but rather a strong feeling for the other, not any, only a deep affection, of those we understand well that we are good, we will be well, we will be well, we will be well, we will be better. Then he runs a love of the Christian way for China without Christ ever been. Such finding can lead us to the assumption of the existence of universal structures, not only logical, including as regards affections, therefore sentimental. After all, selfishness may not be a dominant tendency, there is everything: selfish, aggressive and competitive people, as others will be naturally altruistic, compassionate and cooperatives, ready to recognize the universality of the feeling of love, which crosses borders rather than erecting them, bringing people closer to the most diverse social classes, ethnic groups, geographies, as in "love has no borders", in a direct translation "" (Àiqíng wú jiējí zhī fēn), here is particularly emphasized social borders. The content of the message gains full sense when one realizes that love to oneself takes place in a culture that many consider wrong and prejudiced only to focus on the whole, in the community. Attention to the person, the particular and the style and feeling of each, lives, in philosophies such as Taoist for centuries with the valorization of the collectivity, this ultimate tendency manifestly inculcated and worked by Confucianism. Love to itself, care for the individual body and mind, is emphasized in the so -called Proverbial “well -understood love and virtue must begin with us”, which has the following correspondence in Chinese “爱德从己起” (to Cong Jǐ qǐ). Anyone who imagines that in proverbial wisdom there is only place to praise and sing relational love, since the Chinese do not have any religious philosophy that chants spiritual love above all, in the Christian way of St. Augustine, will be surprised to find the following proverb "where there is no other gentleman", that in a direct translation of the Chinese is "the love above all" 爱情至上 爱情至上 爱情至上ZHì Shàng). If in doubt, there is another saying of complementary meaning and in which the idea of ​​the integrity and unity of this powerful affection, which moves mountains in the Christian sense, when it reads 爱情专一 （（（（iqíng zhuān yī）, in a possible translation "love cannot be broken", "one person cannot have a heart in two parts at the same time." From a psychological point of view, the acceptance of the other in loving terms will have to be complete, so their tastes, affections, relationships, and objects cannot be rejected, as is clear from the lesson "Who loves Beltrão, loves their dog", in a relative correspondence for "爱屋及乌" (ài wū jí wū), which in a literal translation would be "love the house and the crums." As is well known, proverbs are susceptible to various interpretations, so they say polysemic, but if they are perspective as a whole, and only then as pieces of a puzzle, there seems to be many doubts with regard to the proverb philosophy and psychology of Chinese love, which is echoed in the country's scholarly philosophies. In Chapter 67 of the Book of the road and virtue (《道德经》), also known by the name of the Patriarch of Taoism, Lazi (老子), is the first of the three guiding virtues of the Wise Way, Love, as you can read in the translation of Claudia Ribeiro (2004, 139): I have three treasures What entesouro and retains: The first is love (CI), The second frugality, The third is not daring to be the vanguard of the world. (…) For love, In combat, it triumphs, And in defense it is firm. The sky will come to aid And, with love, will protect (我有三寶/寶而持之/一曰慈/二曰儉/三曰不敢為天下先 (……) 夫慈以戰則勝//以守則固/以慈衛之 1) It is noted that while in proverbial philosophy the synogram used for love is 爱/愛 2 (AI), in the scholarly philosophy of the Patriarch of Taoism the term employment is 慈 (CI), that is, love with a strong relational and spiritual burden; Although they are different words, both refer to love, the first concerns the most physical and concrete feeling, centered on the heart of the person and the clutches that hold it; The second to that most relational and general indicates that love comes from inside the heart (内心 nèixīn), where it has the roots, emerging like any plant. However, the truth is that both terms focus on people, or rather in their hearts, affectionate connection with others, such a strong connection that draws the attention of heaven (天 tiān), maximum impersonal power, it ensures victory on all battle fronts, whether in the forefront or rear, when fighting and defended itself for love. Already the patriarch of Confucianism, Confucius (孔子), in the Chapter Twelve, later entitled the deep face, of the Analects (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 22) defines the main virtue of the school, benevolence or humanity, (仁 Rén) as an act of love to others, maintaining the term of the traditional vernacular 爱 (AI): “Fan Chi asked what was the benevolence was what answered, "love people". " (樊遲問仁 ， 子曰 「愛人 3。 ”) It is in this context of love of neighbor, that one of the main maxims of Confucian philosophy must be understood, which arises in the same chapter (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 2)“ Do not make the others what they do not want for you ”(己所不欲勿施於人 jǐ suǒ bù yù shunk yú rén). The essentials in Confucian philosophy will then guarantee love of others in terms of respect or humanity towards others, in order to ensure the normal functioning of society, without extreme sacrifices or exaggerated explorations, given to the proverb containment of confusion in relation to feelings, they are important and useful but should not extravate the boundaries of rationality, that is, even the best of them, will have to be measured, controlled and ritualized in the name of harmony collective. Therefore, the love that moves friendships, especially intellectuals, is the most praised, as we remembered at the end of this chapter (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 24): Zeng Zi stated: “A gentleman resorts to knowing to make friends and friends to cultivate benevolence4” (曾子曰：君以文會友 ， 以友輔仁。) Finally, also the Buddhist philosophy, especially from the Chan (禅 Chán) or Zen meditation line, praises the love of humanity, but indirectly, drawing attention to the heart and the identification of Buddha with the heart, the way of the Daoxin Patriarch (道信) and its maximum proverbially known “the heart is Buddha and Buddha is the heart” (非心不问佛 ， 问佛不非心 fēi xīn bùwèn fu, wèn fi bù fēi xīn). Here you come to love indirectly, only an enlightened heart can love the Buddha, as it is not surprising in the picture of this philosophy, after all what is Buddha but the very love that expresses itself not in a selfish, sick, self -centered heart, but in a heart capable of establishing relationships, healthy, altruistic and without empty, but not indifferent to the other? This confirms it the social and humanitarian actions of Via Mahayana Buddhism, which was accepted in China and unfolds in collective works such as the construction of educational institutions, hospitals, centers of social solidarity, in a proselytist action at all similar to the history of the Christian Church and its missionaries around the world. item.title: Church | Victims of sexual abuse want Leo XIV to assume theme
item.description:
One of the movement spokesmen that represents victims of sexual abuse in the Catholic Church yesterday asked Pope Leo XIV to put the theme as a priority and defines global rules to deal with cases. "Now that we have a new Latin American Pope should be given an example in all Latin American episcopades that, by decision and by the Pope, there can be no double standard" among the various Catholic hierarchies around the world, "said Argentine Sebastián Cuattromo, from the adult collective for the rights of the child. On the day the Pope made the first Sunday greeting in St. Peter's Square, praying Regina Caeli, a group of victims joined the square to ask the Vatican to impose common rules on the whole church. Cuattromo, 42, set an example of what is happening "in the first world societies and Latin America that acts as a Vatican backyard, where the same [repair] demands are not felt, such as they are felt before European public opinion." "As a survivor of childhood sexual abuse within the Catholic Church, with other companions survivors of this crime, we hope that the Pope will make an explicit mention of this question and an explicit reference to what he intends to do about it to pay off very large debts that, in our opinion, the Catholic Church still has to the victims," ​​said Cuattromo. “We victims broke the taboo, silence, denial, concealment, with our struggles, with a huge sacrifice, and reached a level of visibility in public opinion,” which forced the church to face the problem. Therefore, the global group of victims subscribed to a petition already delivered, in which they require “a true zero tolerance law that is established as canonical law”, which would “imply the immediate expulsion of the religious life of anyone involved in these acts”. Moreover, they propose a “Truth Commission that should not be directed by the Vatican, but by international human rights organizations with the United Nations standards and with which the Vatican would have to fully cooperate, freeing all the archives he has on the subject”. Finally, the victims intend a “justice process for the victims, where, among other things, there are concrete actions of reparation and justice for survivors around the world”, with the costs supported by the Church's own goods.
In the first person In his particular case, Sebastian Cuattromo filed an action against a religious from a Catholic school of Buenos Aires for sexual abuse and won the process in 2012, even before the election to the Pope of then Cardinal Bergoglio, archbishop of the Argentine capital. "Then the city's Catholic hierarchy was against the victims and supported the school, which intended to silence the victims of this offense through a private economic agreement," he recalled. "They made us feel a profound underestimation of the severity of the crime we were talking about," because, at that moment, "I was a young man who was fighting in solitude, with many doubts, with a lot less, with much anguish and felt an absolute lack of empathy and, instead, deep arrogance," he explained. After Francis' election, "I invited him publicly and privately to meet with the victims of his country, especially those who had bad experiences," but the Pope "never had the courage or sensitivity of calling us." For the new Pope, who is also accused of having ignored abuse complaints when he was a prior of the Augustinhos, Cuattromo expects Leo XIV to “assume this theme personally” and to be willing to “go to the last consequences”. Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost, 69, was elected Pope on Thursday after two days of Conclave, in the Vatican City, and took the name of Leo XIV.

item.title: Osaka 2025 | Japanese architect Kengo Kuma considers it to be friendly with architecture
item.description: Japanese architect Kengo Kuma states in an interview with Lusa that she wanted to show the uniqueness between Portugal and Japan in the Portuguese Pavilion project at Expo 2025 Osaka and considers AI (artificial intelligence) friendly to architecture. Asked if Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a friend or enemy of architecture, Kengo Kuma opts for the first option. "Yes, it's a friend", because in fact in the design process "we are working with AI". Artificial intelligence “is a very strong team between us” and “we like to work” with this technology, he says. “We wanted to show the relationship with the ocean in Portugal,” says Kengo Kuma, when asked what was the project's inspiration. Portugal participates in Expo Osaka with the theme “Ocean, Blue Dialogue” and is located in the “Empowering Lives” zone, in a lot with 1,836.75 square meters, being close to the Japan Pavilion. The Kuma Kuma project expresses the dynamics of the ocean moment, using 9,972 suspended cables weighing more than 60 tons, and recycled networks to create a perennial effect and exposed to natural elements such as sun and wind, according to the organization. Sea connections The life of Portugal and Japan is “very close to the ocean”, in the sense that “we eat fish, we travel a lot through the oceans and history and life are closely linked to the ocean,” adds the architect. There is this “uniqueness of Portugal and Japan and we want to show” this similarity between the two countries. The volume of the Portugal Pavilion is characterized by a scenic facility that symbolizes the upper square suspended as a wave. "This design is very, very new to the history of art. We have long tried to use lines as a resource for navigation. With these lines, we try to show the beauty of natural phenomena," in the sea "we see natural light and breeze," he explains. “We tried to bring this kind of natural phenomenon to the Expo, perhaps the first attempt in the history of the expo to bring its own nature to the pavilion,” says the architect. About what will happen to the pavilion after finishing the Expo, the architect says he wants to bring the diversity of the project (which includes cables of various diameters and lengths) to different places. “I want to bring this diversity to different places” and “now we are planning to work with some artists” about it. Kengo Kuma said that the Slaughterhouse Project in Porto is completing and has two more projects in Portugal. The architect says he loves the side of the big cities in Portugal, but also the mountainous side and the ocean of the country. “We want to enjoy the diversity of Portugal,” he says. Create Memories Asked how can the more sustainable architecture become currently become, Kengo Kuma considers that "the most important for sustainability is to leave the memory of architecture forever." That is, "architecture, life, basically, are not so permanent." However, “we can leave the memory of architecture forever, which is the connection between architecture and humanity” and this “is the most important for sustainability,” he says. Used to comment on the controversy around his choice to project the Portuguese pavilion, the architect points out that he has an international office working in Portugal. "Maybe that's why we were invited," he concludes. Sobre os desafios que a arquitectura enfrenta actualmente, Kengo Kuma refere que o seu custo está a aumentar “drasticamente” e que todos querem reduzi-lo. "But at the same time, people want to create a new monument" for this pillar. "And the cost and monumentality must walk together" today. Expo 2025 runs since April 13 and runs until October 13 on the artificial island of Yumeshima, located on the edge of Osaka, Kansai, Japan.

item.title: Leo XIV offers Vatican mediation to “silence the weapons”
item.description: Pope Leo XIV yesterday exhorted world leaders to sit down and negotiate to “silence the weapons” and offered the Vatican's mediation to all belligerent parts. "The Holy See is available for enemies to meet and look in their eyes," Leo XIV told Vatican to speak at the representatives of the 23 Catholic churches of the East. The Pope said it is necessary that "peoples can rediscover the hope and dignity to which they are entitled," the dignity of peace. "The people want peace and I, with my heart, say to the leaders of the people: We find, we speak, negotiate! War is never inevitable, weapons can and should be silenced, because they do not solve problems, but increase them," he said. The US Pope's appeal appears on the eve of possible negotiations in the Turkish city of Istanbul about the Russian War against Ukraine. It is also unknown if today's conversations can include a meeting between Russian presidents, Vladimir Putin, and Ukrainian, Volodymyr Zelensky. Other wars have caused suffering in other latitudes, such as the Middle East, Africa or Asia. First-hand Leo XIV said in the Paul VI room, before thousands of people who moved to the jubilee of countries such as Syria, Ukraine, Lebanon and Iraq, which the oriental churches know "firsthand the horrors of war." "To the point that Pope Francis has called martyrs to your churches," he said, quoted by the Spanish news agency Efe. "It is true: from the Holy Land to Ukraine, from Lebanon to Syria, from the Middle East to Tigray [Ethiopia] and to the Caucasus, so much violence," he lamented. The Pope, applauded by the hearing, said the horror of war and "of the massacres of so many young lives" should cause indignation, "because in the name of military conquest people die." He asked him to pray for peace, which he described as "reconciliation, forgiveness, courage to turn the page and start over." “For this peace to differ, I will do everything within my reach,” he promised. Robert Prevost, 69, born in the United States, but with double American and Peruvian nationality, leads the Catholic Church since May 8, under the name of Leo XIV. The academic recently led a lecture at the National Library in Lisbon over the linguist born in Gotha, Germany, in 1842 and died in Graz, Austria, in 1927, being considered one of the most important linguists of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century. The session was called “Hugo Schuchardt and the search for the Luso-Asian Creole”. Despite Schuchardt's interest on Macao's Creole, he did not publish any academic work on the subject, as he told HM Hugo Cardoso. "Schuchardt did not publish any work on Macau. For the professor at FLUL, pioneering in the study of the Creoles is an expression that rhymes with Schuchardt. The German linguist was “absolutely pioneering in this domain, not only in the study of the Luso-sieious Creole or even the Portuguese Lexical Base Creoles globally, but in the study of Creole languages ​​in general” and, for this reason, is “a larger figure in the history of linguistics”. Hugo Cardoso also points out that "as regards the Portuguese lexical base creoles, before him, there had been some activity, especially by Adolfo Coelho, who, in 1881, had published" The Romanesque or Neo-Latin dialects in Africa, Asia and America, "in which he was a caught in several Portuguese-based Creole." However, in this work, Adolfo Coelho refers only to three Luso-Asiatic Creole: “Ceylon's (at Sri Lanka), Malaca and Macau's-giving some examples that he could get from previous publications (such as Macau's Ta-Ss-Yang-Kuo magazine)”. The academic has no doubt that “Hugo Schuchardt was surely inspired by Rabbit's work, but his efforts to obtain primary data from many other Asian places greatly expanded the cartography of the Luso-Asian Creole and resulted in the first published news and the first grammatical descriptions of many of them (such as Diu, Cananor, Mahé, Mangolor, Mangar, Mangar etc.) ”. Future inspirations According to Hugo Cardoso, the German linguist left works that inspired future academics and many materials from the personal archive. In the case of José de Leite Vasconcelos, who wrote the letter cited at the beginning of this text, "it also corresponded with Schuchardt and reveals, in his linguistic studies, the impact of Schuchardt's work." Asked by HM about the possible interconnections between the Creole of IUD, Batávia and Macao, Hugo Cardoso states that there are "continuities between the various Luso-Asian Creole, but also many differences." item.title: PME | Events promoted by Melco generated $ 1 million
item.description:
Melco Resorts claims to have generated about $ 1 million for small and medium -sized local businesses through events promoted last year. In the 2024 sustainability report, the game operator also highlights the results in terms of waste management and energy spending
The Melco Resorts & Entertainment Sustainability Report has just been published last year, which highlights the gains obtained by small and medium -sized (SMEs) with the events promoted by the operator. With regard to the “community engagement and investment” part, it is read that “more than $ 1.02 million for local companies and [NGO] non-governmental organizations in Macao through 21 SME events, with 603 SME and NGO participants” were generated. In addition, in the volunteering area, Melco points out that "about 3,600 participants offered their time and effort in more than 359 volunteering initiatives," "more than $ 17.42 million that were donated to decent causes in our communities." Quoted by the report, Lawrence Ho, Melco's president and executive director, says that "21 Heart of House initiatives and community events have generated more than $ 1 million for local companies in Macao, providing 603 SMEs and NGO opportunities to connect, expand and grow." According to the official, last year were "in -depth partnerships with PME and NGO". Regarding the relationship with local SMEs, Melco also highlights the connection with the supply chain, because “86 percent of acquisitions arose from local companies in Macao”, and of this total, “59 percent were local SME acquisitions”. Similar scenario occurred in the other operators that Melco holds in Cyprus and Manila, with local acquisitions around 40 and 76 percent, respectively. Regarding the company's training actions, Melco says it has invested on average "582 US dollars per full -time worker in learning and development activities, which is equivalent to an average of 38 hours of training." In this context, “100 percent of colleagues participated in training actions”, can be read. In addition, "over 758,000 participants have attended more than 1,400 courses offered by" Melco Learning Academy ", which is equivalent to over 870,000 hours of learning." Also noteworthy is that, in all Melco projects, "women represent 23 percent of the boards of business and 32 percent of the higher paintings." The report also tells that “63 percent of positions at the vice-presidency level, or above this post, were filled from local communities, increasing to 70 percent in Macao”, can read. All for the environment Another of the areas highlighted in Melco's sustainability report concerns environmental policies. One of the areas that is “in progress” is the energy consumption, in order to obtain more reasonableness of consumption. "In 2024, despite an increase of 39 percent in terms of the number of visitors and the rise of 19 percent in the occupation rate of the hotel rooms, along with the addition of a property and a new resort integrated into our portfolio, the energy intensity increased by 10 percent from 2023, but was 19 percent lower than our year of reference 2019." One of the “achieved” objectives is the energy efficiency measures, which “since 2018 has resulted in an annualized savings of more than 62.5 million kWh, an increase of 9 percent compared to 2023”. Another "achieved" goal concerns the installation of "over 25,000 photovoltaic panels on all properties in Macau, Manila and Cyprus, generating about 10,000 kWh annually." Thus, in the properties of Melco "the electricity consumption from renewable sources increased by 72 percent compared to 2023". Regarding the group's means of transportation, “buses, electric and hybrid vehicles represent 55 percent of our combined fleet, with loading stations, an increase of 25 percent compared to 2023”. In terms of materials and waste management, Melco says it has avoided plastic spending in the order of 13.2 million bottles, thanks to the installation of “the Nordaq water filtering system that serves almost every hotel rooms in Melco Integrated Resorts”. In addition, the example of the City of Dreams venture in Manila is presented where “a circular economy system was established in which food waste is decomposed on site, and the excess donated to a local fifth to cultivate some of the vegetables served to guests”. In terms of water consumption, the report indicates that “despite the increase in the number of visitors and the hotel occupancy rate”, “total water consumption and water intensity increased only 6 and 2 percent compared to 2023, respectively, and were 6 and 30 percent lower, respectively, to the 2019 reference year”. However, this is a goal that, according to the company, is still "in progress". Another objective highlighted in the report was the “annual economy of over 510,820 cubic meters of water through water efficiency measures, an increase of 10 percent compared to 2023 ″. "As we invest in people and communities, we continue to derive environmental efforts with the same determination. (…) The intensity of energy and water consumption, as well as greenhouse gas emissions, remained significantly below our 2019 base line, even adding a new property and an integrated resort," says Lawrence Ho. The entrepreneur also referred to the increase "of the amount of valuable materials diverted through recycling and composting in global operations - 58 percent over last year." “In our restoration spaces we also fight food waste, with the 'clean dish challenge' to contribute to a 9 percent reduction in waste in the Macao and Manila restoration areas.” “Mentality change” For Lawrence Ho, greater sustainability in Melco requires "a change of mindset" verified in "small actions that, on scale, can have a significant impact." Regarding the supply chain of the group's integrated hotels and resorts, good results are also highlighted. "Although the numbers do not always show exponential heels, our focus on responsible supply remains unshakable, 18 percent of all seafood bought by weight to be sustainable sources, and 100 percent of our points of sale of food and beverage in Macau and Manila to serve eggs of outdoor chickens," he reads. There is thus "an effort that reflects a deeper ambition to incorporate sustainability into acquisitions," said Lawrence Ho, who added that "more than one service, hospitality has to do with the experience it creates, the people it supports and the impact it leaves." “Every year, Melco challenges himself to go further, believing that luxury and responsibility are not opposite forces, but partners in progress, which is reflected in the way we defend strong governance, we manage our environmental impact, we support our people and communities and lead the responsible game. This commitment to progress shaped our approach in 2024, as a year of recalibration in which we continue to strengthen operations, operations, rekindle the impetus and ensure that our integrated resorts remain at the forefront of excellence, ”he concluded.

item.title: Seismos | Macau will have a monitoring station in national partnership
item.description:

The Macao government announced on Wednesday the creation, together with the interior authorities of China, of a seismic monitoring station, as part of the authorities' plans to reinforce disaster prevention. “The meteorological and seismic monitoring network will be optimized, and is foreseen, in collaboration with the competent services of the interior of China, the construction of a seismic monitoring station,” said the secretary for public works and transport, by presenting, in the Legislative Assembly (AL), the lines of government action (LAG) for the guardianship, for 2025. Raymond Tam will justified the new station with the intention of "increasing the capacity for analysis and evaluation in the scope of natural disasters." The space has realized in the direction of the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG), will be located in Hengqin. "Macao's earthly area is small and population density is very high, so it is difficult to find space for the creation of monitoring stations and now with the favorable policies with Guangdong province, we have been able to build a joint monitoring station in the cooperation zone [deepened between Guangdong and Macau]," SMG director Leong Weng Kun said. The official noted that the space should contribute to "increasing prevention capacity and public knowledge about weather information." Agree Macao and Zhuhai signed the “comprehensive and deepened cooperation project in the context of meteorology” to reinforce the cooperation and sharing of meteorological detection equipment, computer programs and data sharing, according to a statement released by SMG at that time. Cooperation is also expected to reinforce the “joint prevention of weather catastrophs alert systems, promote scientific and technological research and the development of artificial intelligence applied to weather activity”. Macao is often affected between May and November by the passage of Tuffons, being July to September the period in which the highest incidence of tropical storms is recorded. This year, the territory is expected to be affected by between five to eight tropical storms, SMG announced in March. The ruler said that "public housing policies will be reviewed and perfected, promoting the construction of social and economic housing and ensuring rational availability, in order to satisfy the housing needs of residents with different levels of income." item.title: Macao prepares digital currency for trade between China and Lusophone countries
item.description: Secretary for Economics and Finance, Tai Kin IP, revealed that he intends to finalize the Pataca Digital system in 2025 and use it as a commercial settlement instrument for transactions between China and Portuguese-speaking countries "We hope that Digital Pataca can be used as one of the digitized transaction instruments for Portuguese-speaking countries, commercial transactions, and sino-Portuguese transactions," said Anton Tai Kin IP. In response to deputies' questions during the Legislative Assembly session, the secretary confirmed that the central digital currency system should be finalized by the end of 2025, following a series of technical tests. "The first phase of implementation will focus on retail transactions before expanding to gross applications," said Tai. "We then intend to leave Macau to connect with the Portuguese Language platform," he added. It is recalled that a delegation led by Tai Kin IP was in Lisbon in early March, having met with leaders of Banco de Portugal, including administrator Luís Morais Sarmento. At the end of March, the secretary's office announced in a statement that the various meetings served to “negotiate the consolidation and deepening of cooperation between Macao and Portugal in the areas of science, technology, economy and commerce”. Tai Kin IP told deputies on Tuesday that he would continue to visit more Portuguese-speaking countries in the future to seek support for the use of Digital Pataca. The secretary promised to take advantage of Digital Pataca as a currency whose circulation will be free through the borders of Macao, an economy open to the flow of capital. On the contrary, the Chinese currency, Renmimbi, is not entirely convertable in other currencies, and Beijing authorities impose a strict control on the flow of capital, especially out of the country. Digital seeds Trading between Portuguese -speaking countries and China reached $ 225.2 billion last year, 2 percent more than in 2023, according to data from China customs services. The prototype of the Macao Digital Pataca System (e-Mop) was launched on December 12, eight days before the end of the term of the previous government leader, Ho Iat Seng. In September, the then financial regulator of the region said that Pataca Digital could “serve as an example for Portuguese -speaking countries”. Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM) President Benjamin Chan Sa San spoke during the second conference of the central banks and financial banks governors between China and the Portuguese -speaking countries, which took place in Macao. At the opening of the event, Ho Iat Seng said E-Mop's development was supported by the Government and Central Bank of China, which was the first major economy in the world to launch a digital currency, the Digital Renmimbi or E-CNY in August 2020. In September, AMCM explained that, before the official launch of Pataca Digital, it would take tests to identify risks and “establish laws and regulations”. The regulator stressed that, unlike private cryptocurrencies (the best known to Bitcoin), E-MOP will be “a currency with legal course”, with the same legal status and monetary value as Pataca currencies and physical notes.

item.title: Metro | People's Covenant defends acceleration of connection to China

The slight meter should be the main means of public transport in Macao, while buses move to a secondary and complementary role. Tong Ho Laam understands that when the lightweight metro stations network is extended, it will increase the overall effectiveness of public transport and ensure better experiences to residents and tourists. After this meeting, the secretary for Macau's economy and finance told reporters that Xia Baolong also appealed to the unit against "the increase in unilateralism and commercial protectionism in the United States." “Hong Kong and Macao entrepreneurs have to be united and put themselves on the same side of the state. item.title: Hong Kong Queen's College's cadabulas
item.description:
Last April, during the Unified History Test of China at the Hong Kong Queen's College, several students from one of the classes copied. They shouted the answers to each other, consulted the books and the iPads. The vigilante tried several times to stop them, but failed. The board of the college said that it will only punish prevariculars students according to internal rules. The college also notified parents about this incident, saying that as only a month left for final exams and, to avoid unnecessary pressures about the students, the test will not be repeated. The results of the China Unified History Test of this class will be canceled and the classification to this discipline will depend on the final exam. For the other classes, the classification of China's History discipline will take into account the results of the unified test and the final exam. Students often happen to copy the tests. With new technologies, the tools that allow them to “make cheats” change every day. From traditional paper rackets to intelligent devices, the evolution of these tools reflects the erosion of academic integrity through the abuse of technology. In the past, the students wrote the answers to pieces of paper, commonly known to rabids, and took them to the exam room; Or asked to go to the bathroom and so they consulted the materials. With the popularization of intelligent clocks, real -time concerted communication functions allow remotely online cabular. If the vigilante is not aware, students can use smart watches for this purpose while sitting in their places. Real -time -time translation functions have recently appeared that can directly convert English to Chinese texts. The constant evolution of these tools makes the work of vigilantes increasingly difficult. To get a thief, we need evidence. To get a gussy student, you also have to have tests. However, for vigilantes, it is always very difficult to obtain these evidence; If they can't prove that the student copied, it is complicated to accuse him. In the case of the "Cada on paper", the student can swallow or hide it as they are being exposed, or argue with the vigilante and refuse to deliver the rabula. Teachers are not police officers and are not entitled to review students, so several "jams" escape unpunished for lack of tests and naturally cannot be accused. These cases, to some extent, lead other students to risk. There is certainly no lack of diligent students, scholars and workers in an exam room. When these students discover the colleagues' strokes, they can choose to report them, but if they do the most likely it is to be ostracized and subject to intimidation. In addition, the highly stressful exam environment makes most students focus on their own answers, and have no time or energy to observe others. Therefore, the reports of colleagues represent a small percentage and the exposure of these cases depends on the vigilantes to be committed and want to discover the offenders. Copy, use fake certificates and plagiarize are all academic violations of the same nature - dishonesty and bad practices. In recent years, it is not difficult to find these cases in the news. Having this incident in one of Hong Kong's oldest elite colleges, reflects not only the moral deviation of the students, but also the distortion of learning values. The more students make glow, the greater the change of values ​​and the less they will study hard. The “elite” group created by false achievements may seem knowledgeable, but in fact is devoid of value and will eventually expose their lack of knowledge in their areas in the future. Just think: Can a doctor without skills treat a patient? Can a lawyer defend the client without knowing the law? This hidden danger is like a clock pump. Its destructive power continues to manifest in the next decade or even later, and finally the whole society will pay its price. We have to stop this problem. Schools have to take proper measures, prescribe the right medicine, improve situations that give it azo and cultivate the correct values ​​in students. Containing the jar requires multi-dimensional efforts. Firstly, students who copy should be severely punished and this behavior cannot be tolerated. Schools must have rules for dealing with unusual behaviors. For example, if at least two vigilantes see a student swallowing papers, it should be disqualified from the exam. After the punishment must be re -educated. Schools must have subjects that deal with academic integrity and compulsory courses that shape the values ​​of learning. It is necessary to make students understand that a grade of 60 is not shameful, but it is vital that they realize that a false 100 has to be punished. Since this pedagogical idea becomes consensual, society will no longer judge heroes by their grades, students will be able to maintain their moral values ​​and the entrepreneurial spirit of “knowing shame and then learning to be brave” will reappear. Only after stressing the importance of identifying the “real value” of students can education return to its original purpose of “teaching and sharing knowledge”, the reasons that lead to glow can decrease and the promotion of talented people will no longer be a game that compares large and small number.

item.title: FRC welcomes debate today with Sandro Mendonça

The session, more specifically, addresses the theme “Steering the Evolving Sandbox Economy 'from the Greater Bay to the Portuguese-Speaking Geographies”, focusing on the economies of the great bay in connection with Portuguese-speaking countries. Thus, it is intended to “explore the concept of experimental innovation zones, the so-called 'sand boxes', such as children's recreational spaces, which allow future advances through the creation of controlled and secure test areas to test, replicate, evaluate, adopt, implement and launch new products, devices, technologies or systems, within a conditioned and provisional structure”. With these “experimental” environmental processes associated with the economy, effective means of evaluating the development of innovative ideas and projects without ruptures in the normal functioning of business or institutional structures ”. "Greater freedom within these parallel systems [sand boxes] with more dynamic and flexible regulation can be promoted." Sandro Mendonça focuses on concrete in the Greater Bay region, as it covers “a set of cities that form a techno-institutional innovation center, even Portuguese-speaking countries that begin to use these experimental models, namely in the sectors of telecommunications and energy”. item.title: BBC | Concert “Seven Worlds, a Planet” takes place in July
item.description:
It takes place on July 12, at the Broadway Theater, a show that promises to be an immersive experience about the environment and the growing need for its preservation. This is the debut of the live BBC concert “Sete Mundos, a planet”, played in partnership with the Macau Orchestra
"An immersive audiovisual experience that reveals the wonders of our planet." This is how the Cultural Institute (IC) presents the next international concert hosted in Macau, in partnership with Galaxy. This is the live BBC concert “Seven Mundos, a planet”, integrated in the 2024-2025 season of Macau Orchestra (OM) concerts, which takes place on July 12, 8 pm, at Broadway Theater at Broadway Macau. According to a note from the IC, the concert integrates “impressive excerpts from the BBC's famous homonymous documentary series, accompanied by the live bands played by OM and who were composed by the winner of the Sound Band category in the Hans Zimmer academy prizes and the Emmy Jacob Shea winner”. The public can thus have access to an "immersive audiovisual experience through the wonderful landscapes of the seven continents of the planet, designed on a giant ultra-high definition and live narration display." Television success “Seven Worlds, a Planet” is one of the most popular natural history television series in the BBC of the United Kingdom, having been produced for four years in 41 countries. The series portrays “dazzling natural landscapes on the planet's continents”, having debuted in 2019 and was widely acclaimed. At that time, the “record of the highest audience for documentaries at BBC One” was beaten, with the production to be contemplated with “multiple awards”. On July 12, OM joins the Australian conductor Vanessa Scammell to interpret “moving musical works” composed by the award-winning conductor of soundtrack Hans Zimmer and Emmy winner Jacob Shea. One of the compositions is “Out There”, a co-composition of the same award-winning conductor and the famous singer and songwriter Sia. In addition, Jason Chan, Hong Kong artist, will take on the role of narrator in English, "leading the audience in a surrounding sensory trip that intertwines music and image by exploring the stories of the natural wonders of the seven continents." The partnership with Galaxy is made in the context of the “GEG Space Partnership Pilot Plan”. item.title: COVID-19 | Macau exceeded peak infections
item.description:
Covid-19 infections have been progressively decreased since half of March, when the peak has been reached, but health services warn that coronavirus is still active in the territory. Authorities add that this year there were no deaths resulting from Covid-19
While in the neighboring regions of Macao, COVID-19 infection cases continue to increase, here infection rates have been gradually descended since half of March, health services indicated in a statement released on Tuesday night. Authorities add that although the Mand has surpassed the most critical point of covid-19 infections, coronavirus remains active in the territory. As such, they appeal to the care and adoption of preventive attitudes, especially between risk groups, such as elderly, chronic diseases and people with weakened immune system, namely taking complete vaccination against the JN.1 variant. Regarding the evolution of infection rates in Macao and neighboring regions, the entity led by Alvis Lo explains that Macau entered the infectious peak before the surrounding areas. According to laboratory monitoring data, the positivity rate of the new coronaviruses detected in patients with flu symptoms in Macau began to increase in late February this year, reaching the peak in mid -March. In March 16 and 22, the authorities record a positivity rate of 44.3 percent, which was decreasing from there. In the last three weeks, the positivity rate has come down to 12 percent, rose to 17 percent and then went back to 11 percent, "which indicates a slight recovery," the health services concluded. Walk there With regard to collective infections that result in flu symptoms, between the beginning of the year and this week 111 cases were recorded, of which 26 were from COVID-19, detected mainly in elderly homes. In these cases, the authorities ensure that they have adequate medical services to the elderly homes, prescribing antiviral medications. Throughout this year, so far, Macao has not registered any critical or fatal case caused by Covid-19 infection, is indicated. The prevalent coronavirus variant in Macao is currently the XDV variant related to DN.1, which is basically the same that circulates in the surrounding areas. The latest data do not show that XDV causes more serious illnesses than JN.1, XBB and its descendant strains. As such, health services ensure that the JN.1 variant vaccine remains effective in reducing “risk of infection and developing serious diseases caused by the currently prevalent variant.

item.title: BNU | 133.2 million profits in the first quarter
item.description:
Positive results show a 30 million patacas reduction compared to last year's first quarter. The reduction of the financial net margin was the main factor to contribute to the reduction of gains
In the first three months of the year, the Nacional Overseas Bank presented a non -audited profit of 133.2 million patacas, according to a statement issued yesterday. The value represents a reduction of 30 million patacas, or 18.4 percent, compared to the first quarter of 2024, when the profit had reached 163.2 million patacas. Despite the reduction of profits, the amount is still above 2023 levels, when the institution declared a profit to the first quarter of 122.4 million patacas. The amounts presented yesterday are also close to what was happening in 2019, the last year before the pandemic, when profits in the first in the first quarter reached 138 million Patacas. The most recent results were explained with a decrease in the net financial margin, which presented a reduction of 31.2 million patacas, or 11.8 percent, compared to the same period. Among the facts that contributed to this amendment, the institution pointed out the “changes in the composition of deposits and the evolution of reference interest rates”. However, there were areas where the bank was able to get better results, as happened with liquid commissions, an area where an increase in gains of 3.8 million patacas was generated, equivalent to 18.1 percent. The increase was explained with "greater economic activity and greater customer involvement." Squeezed In the first quarter of this year, impairment losses related to credit exhibitions, mischievous credit, and financial investments increased to 5.4 million patacas, compared to the value of 1.3 million patacas in the first quarter of 2024. According to BNU, this increase took into account the “prudent provisioning practices”. "Despite this increase, the quality of BNU assets remains solid, supported by conservative credit practices and a robust level of provisions to respond to ongoing macroeconomic uncertainties," he was guaranteed. At the same time, operating expenses increased by 1.1 percent in homologous terms, which according to the institution showed “the effectiveness of bank cost optimization initiatives”. “Efficiency gains resulting from process simplification and strategic review of service supply helped compensate added investments in digital transformation, talent development and brand reinforcement,” was considered. Last year, the institution led by Carlos Cid Álvares ended the year with a profit of 585.1 million patacas.

item.title: IAS | Number of families supported up to the highest value since 2020
item.description:
Although the value of the threshold of poverty in Macau was not up to date for almost five years, the number of families supported by the Inclusion and Harmony Program in the community again exceeded the 5,500 barrier. May registration represented an annual growth of almost 13 percent
The number of monoparental families, with people with disabilities, or with chronic patients who will receive the May Special Grant from the Inclusion and Harmony Program in the community has risen to 5,540. With a growth of 12.9 percent compared to the same period last year, this is the highest value, at least since 2020, according to the Institute of Social Action (IAS). This program is intended to “alleviate life pressure” of single-padded families, people with disabilities or chronic patients considered “vulnerable”. Last year, the number of approved families to receive May support to face poverty had been 4,905, a reduction in the face of 2023, when the number of aided families had been 4,049. Since 2021 that the number of families gathering conditions to access this support has not exceeded 5,000, which totaled 5,043. However, the highest value of the recent years was recorded by 2020 during the pandemic when a total of 5,503 families were supported. The community inclusion and harmony program foresees the distribution of two supports, one in May and one in October, which are accessed through applications approved by IAS. It should be noted that the data presented only consider only the distribution of support in May of previous years. Natural Trends Among the 5,540 subsidized families is a total of 1,300 household aggregates who also receive the allowance for people in economic lack. These families are the poorest in the territory, whose monthly income is below what is considered the threshold of the social risk of poverty. This level represents yields of 4,350 patacas per month, in the case of a single individual, rises to 7,990 patacas per month in households with two people, 11,020 patacas, in families with three people, 13,390 patacas with four people, 15,120 patacas when the aggregate consists of five people, progressively rising up to 20,270 patacas for eight or more members. These numbers have not undergone any change since 2019, in the first month of the Ho IAT SENG term, so they do not take into account the inflation of later years, which makes these amounts of purchasing power less than December 2019. Regarding families with income below the social risk of poverty, the number of supports has been falling every year since 2020. In this year, there were 1,618 aggregates to receive the May subsidy of the community inclusion and harmony program, which was reduced to 1,576 in 2021, then to 1,486 by 2022, 1,385, at 2023, 1,308, until 1,300 families this year. Less is no longer The increase in the number of supported families is explained by the growth of households with monthly income above the social risk of poverty, but lower than the maximum limits for these supports. For aggregates with more than one person, the maximum limit of monthly income to access this support is 7,830 patacas, rises to 13,983 patacas per month in the aggregates with two people, 18,737 patacas in families with three members, 22,094 patacas in four members, 24,192 patacas in families with five members. The value rises progressively until it reaches the limit of 29,392 patacas per month, when families have eight or more members. In 2020, the number of families under these conditions was 3,885, but fell to 3,467 in 2021 and to 3,125 in 2022, the lowest value since 2020. However, since this year the number of families in this income interval increased to 4,240. This is an increase of 335 families compared to the first year of the pandemic. Supports of 22.55 million The community inclusion and harmony program foresees the distribution of a total of 22.55 million patacas in May this year, the highest value since 2020, when 23.67 million patacas were distributed. The program foresees the distribution of supports ranging from 2,650 patacas to household aggregates with a single person, and 10,100 patacas, when the aggregate consists of eight or more members, so an increase in the number of supported families does not necessarily reflect an increase in total distributed supports. This support is distributed intended for single people with children in kindergarten, primary school, secondary or higher education; as well as households with members with chronic diseases or disabilities that are not admitted to public homes or subsidized by the government or in medical establishments dependent on health services.

item.title: Joey Lao calls for more action in the development of hengqin
